data.title: Added intensity back into the PointLight.
data.body:
It would be better to get the intensity back into the light itself, and get the rgb color computed in the shader instead of having it precomputed.

The reason for this is that the intensity information can be used later on in the shader itself, instead of deriving it from the rgb color. Furthermore it's very easy to check if the intensity is 0 not to run the shader illumination calculation part since there are apparently always 5 lights.

data.title: Music setPosition() missing
data.body:
Hello. I see that the Music API has getPosition() method, but no setPosition()...
I think that sePosition will be verry helpful for games that rely on the music.

I saw the same issue here: https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?can=2&start=0&num=100&q=&colspec=ID%20Type%20Status%20Priority%20Milestone%20Owner%20Summary&groupby=&sort=&id=949
but i saw that it is closed so I tought to create a new one.

data.title: Cell.minSize(float width, float height) sets minHeight to the given width
data.body:
> What steps will reproduce the problem?
> 1. run code:

```
Table table = new Table();
table.add(new Label("some text", someSkin)).minSize(400, 200);
table.debug();
stage.addActor(table);
```
1. watch results

> What is the expected output? What do you see instead?

Table should be 400x200 pixels, instead it's 400x400 pixels.

> What version of libgdx are you using? If not using the master git
> branch, please try that before filing a bug.

LibGDX 1.1.1

> Please provide any additional information below.

In Cell.java the function minSize (float width, float height) calls "minSize(new Fixed(width));", it should instead call minSize(new Fixed(width), new Fixed(height));".

data.title: Changing a button's skin to one with a smaller margin keeps the old size
data.body:
When creating , and button.setStyle() is called with a smaller margin, the button will now appear larger than it should, exactly as large as it was with the larger skin.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create 2 skins, one containing a 9-patch with a certain margin, and another with a smaller margin (the same 9-patch resized works).
2. Create a ImageTextButton button with the larger skin applied and any image.
3. Call button.setStyle() with the smaller skin. Optionally, then call button.pack(), button.invalidate() and button.invalidateHierarchy().

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
The button should look smaller, like it would be if the smaller skin were applied directly. Instead the button has the new skin but is very large. The same applies to all button types.

What version of libgdx are you using? If not using the master git
branch, please try that before filing a bug.

1.2.0

Please provide any additional information below.

The bug seems to be caused because the inherited Table.background variable retains the old background when getPrefWidth() is called internally at Table.getPrefWidth(), line "if (background != null) return Math.max(width, background.getMinWidth());", which sets the Cell width/height to keep the old size. The background variable is changed when draw() is called, but by then it's too late and it is always drawn too big.

data.title: g3d Model additional attributes
data.body:
- Additional textures : ambient, emissive, reflection, unknown.
  "Unknown" make sure that all all textures can be accessed by at least a
  custom shader.

binding (sampler2D) :
u_ambientTexture
u_reflectionTexture
u_emissiveTexture
- Texture translation and scaling for diffuse and specular textures.

binding (vec2) :
u_diffuseUVTranslation
u_diffuseUVScaling
u_specularUVTranslation
u_specularUVScaling

data.title: TextAreas Not Scrollable in ScrollPane
Important marketing advice
data.body:
Please sort the list of games on official site by their popularity, so visitors can immediately see what can be achieved with LibGDX. For example I had to spend much time searching for really successful games such as Apparatus. At now there is one whole page with links to this game instead of just placing it in first page. I suggest to assign a score to each game (by hand or let the site visitors to do it) and let server-side script show sorted list.
I am confident that efforts will be worthy of it and people's first impression will improve significantly.
Thanks.

data.title: Dialog
set empty Gdx.* fields and made get[Component]() methods work in headless backend
data.body:
`HeadlessApplication#get[Input/Graphics/Audio]()` returned null even though `HeadlessApplication` had corresponding mock implementations.  
Correct me if I'm wrong, but I guess this was because the getters were forgotten when those mock implementations were added.

I don't think they returned null intentionally because the `Gdx.[audio/graphics]` fields were set (`Gdx.input` wasn't though, so it seems it was forgotten as well).

data.title: Update IOSApplication for UIApplicationLaunchOptions
data.body: Naughty robovm.

data.title: Json tagToClass checked only after ClassReflection
data.body:
I'm just making sure this is intentional because it looks a little funny to me.

In Json#readValue the tagToClass map is only checked after a ReflectionException is thrown from the ClassReflection check.
I would expect the map to be checked first; using the map in an exception handler would be slow.

data.title: Use GWT Gradle plugin version 0.5. Remove maven Local as a default repository.  Adds jcenter repository.
data.body:
- Updated GWT Gradle plugin to 0.5. No breaking changes, support for more recent Gradle versions
- GWT Gradle plugin is now pushing to jcenter instead relying on github to host. Woohoo!
- Removes mavenLocal() as a default repository.

data.title: Remove gdx-ai from core repo
data.body:
- Remove from parent pom.
- Remove from build
- Removed tests
- Removed code

data.title: Assets copying with GWT crashes
data.body:
Whenever I build the GWT distribution (gradlew html:dist) or use superDev mode (gradlew html:superDev) I often get an error. This error can be for any random asset, not open in another application as far as I know. It seems that retrying a couple of times, shutting down other java applications (which of one seems to be spawned by the gradle process and not to disappear) . I have IntelliJ open, but have the assets folder as excluded.

Occasionally the problem disappears and everything works flawless. If I restart my computer then, things start to fail again most likely.

This is a very annoying bug and makes working with GWT somewhat miserable at times.

```
Configuration on demand is an incubating feature.
```

data.title: Proper mouse support for Android backend
data.body:
This PR adds the handling of mouse cursor movement and scroll wheel on Android 3.1+. It also correctly report the mid and right mouse buttons on 4.0+

I've tested this with a USB mouse and the touchpad on my ASUS Transformer tablet. (Had to manually configure the tablet not to report mid/right buttons as menu and back.) I've also tested it on my old Archos 43 to make sure I didn't break anything all the way back to Android 2.2.

data.title: Screen content moved right, even in tests
data.body:
Hello, I saw that when my application is started on an ultrawide monitor (21:9, 2560x1080), whole content of window is moved to the right in amount of about 10 pixels, regardless if widow is maximized or not. I know that it is not my fault because it happens even in tests and demos. Only rendering is messed up because menu clicks are interpreted right (they are registered from border to the place where they should end, so they are not displaced).
Here is screenshot:
![screenshot from 2014-09-07 00 23 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5205244/4176803/d6e29a24-3616-11e4-8617-6f97b3804939.png)

data.title: Hiero Settings file supporting UTF-8 glyphs
data.body:
hi,
glyphs like "" can be used in hiero but not retrieved from its settings file.

data.title: Add description to ProjectDependencies, add tool-tips on extension selec...
data.body:
...tion

Gives users a little description on each of the extensions when they hover over them in the setup.

data.title: Suggestion: Touchpad - Extend touchBounds to increase control
data.body: I just ported my project from AndEngine to libGDX and have noticed that it is more difficult to control the gun sight in libGDX because the Touchpad has a smaller area of control. I think it would be a good idea to add a method to expand touchBounds. I would love to contribute code but do not have the knowledge to do so.

data.title: Prevent Timers from being wiped out
data.body: This fixes #2274 by removing Timer.checkStatics and instead implementing @suluke's suggestion in #1548 to set Timer.thread to null on pause. This should prevent the issue he reported, while also removing the possibility of internal Timer instantiations wiping out user-created Timers.

data.title: Added clearChildrenActions
data.body:
Added a convenience method to clear Group children actions. Also, clarified on the java doc that Group clear() doesn't clear children actions automatically.

In my opinion, ideally clear() and remove() methods would accept an extra boolean argument to determine whether to clear actions/listeners or not. That would probably break too much code though.

data.title: Add isDrawContact and setDrawContact methods to gwt emu, fixes #2301
setDrawContact() missing
data.body:
setDrawContact() fails when compiling for GWT.
[Box2DDebugRenderer.java](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/extensions/gdx-box2d/gdx-box2d-gwt/src/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/box2d/gwt/emu/com/badlogic/gdx/physics/box2d/Box2DDebugRenderer.java) file does not contain such function.

Cheers

data.title: JsonWriter outputs numerical strings unquoted
Cell.minSize(float, float) Cell.maxSize(float, float) bug
Added frame identification support.
data.body:
Frame identification is a very cheap and common technique to avoid repeating calculations during the same frame.
Of course if you're writing an app you can quickly implement this technique inside the render() method of your ApplicationListener.
However, if you're writing a gdx extension or any high abstraction level framework the above solution is not acceptable. In these cases, a cleaner solution is possible only if the gdx core provides frame identification support directly.

In fact, I've tried to exploit Gdx.graphics.getRawDeltaTime() hoping that it always takes different values for subsequent frames, see https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2202#discussion_r15785050. Unfortunately, it turned out that the delta time has the same value of the previous frame more than once per minute. In short, it's a ugly hack, and performs poorly too.

So I added the getFrameId method to the Graphics interface and implemented this feature for all the back-ends but the robovm one, because unfortunately I can't compile and test.

Finally I'm sorry for the wall of pink in this PR. I've literally spent countless hours so far trying to get rid of it. Unfortunately it happens too rarely to see if you have found the ultimate solution. I won't give up though :)

data.title: getInputStream ()  in NetJavaImpl
data.body:
The returned InputStream seems to cause issues in the LWJGL backend. On GWT it is fine.

Wrapping the bytes in ByteArrayInputStream works though.

Might be because of getInputStream returning a InputStream thats being too long, whereas getResult() is capped by connection.getContentLength.

data.title: Fixes 2136: music keeps playing
data.body:
A proposed fix for #2136 (with thanks to @HD_92 and @Tom-Ski) as discussed in http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=16085#p69622 and following.

I've also added this to `didBecomeActive()` on the presumption that if `allowIpod` is `true`, then this is the behaviour that developers will be expecting. If it's not done here, then it becomes a subtle bug. However, if not desired, I'll add to the docs instead.

I've confirmed that this fixes #2136 on an iPad Mini running iOS 7.0.4 (and I also confirmed that the bug repros without the fix, just to double-check).

My Eclipse settings removed trailing spaces and unused imports. If this contravenes style guidelines, let me know and I'll disable and re-submit. Thanks!
